meanings.definition: To send back or return, as to a lower court
meanings.sent1: The judge decided to remand the case to the lower court for further review.
meanings.sent2: The appellate court may remand a case if new evidence comes to light.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer joked that he could remand the paperwork to his assistant for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to remand the assignment to the students for corrections.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to remand the suspect to the custody of the local police department.
